intro: Agathosma eckloniana, commonly known as Cape garlic. It is a small, evergreen shrub native to South Africa, characterized by its aromatic, needle-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is part of the Rutaceae family and is known for its strong, pungent scent. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Agathosma eckloniana is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
